subsection.title: Review of Discrete Compouding
subsection.p: Earlier we learned that exponents count how many times the growth factor is repeated. The expression 296(1.013)^{5} is stating an initial amount of 296 increased by 1.3 \% compounded 5 times.
The exponent 5 means the 1.3 \% increase happens 5 times in a row.

example.p: Consider the expression 296(1.013)^{\frac{t}{10}} with t counting time in years. What would t have to be so the exponent counts 5 increases of 1.3 \%?

statement.p: Given 296(1.013)^{\frac{t}{10}} it would take t= years in order to get just 5 increases of the growth factor.
